results.title: St. Albans: an ethnic programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: St Albans is a multilingual, multicultural community where 85% of the population are migrants from non-English speaking countries. St Albans East primary school, with a schools commission grant, employ parents in a program to increase the children’s awareness of community languages and culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart and Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre

results.title: Standing in the shadows of Motown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Justman, Sandy Passman and Rimshot Productions
results.brief_description: This award winning, acclaimed documentary is in part a biographical profile of the Funk Brothers, the Hitsville studio band originally assembled by Berry Gordy in 1959, who played behind numerous Motown Records hits, but whose talents went largely unsung. In this work remaining band members are reunited to reminisce about past glories and those departed, and in order to stage a concert that celebrates their contribution to music. Using archival footage, this work also addresses the cultural revolution of the rhythm and blues movement of the 1950s and the racism and inequities that saw the originators of the music, principally African Americans, languish whilst their white counterparts (such as Elvis Presley) prospered. In Detroit the Funk brothers overcame these hurdles with a new sound - known as Motown - that not only championed their artistry but also were phenomenally successful, producing hit after hit. Musicians featured in the reunion concert include: Joan Osborne, Ben Harper, Me’Shell Ndege Ocello, Chaka Khan, Bootsy Collins and the Funk Brothers.

results.title: Stand on your head
results.brief_description:
Stand on your head
This is a film about aging, attitude’and yoga.
Come on a journey to the centre of a suburban yoga class to witness elderly women, some in their nineties, practising yoga. Though they no longer stand on their heads, they do turn society’s perception of the elderly on its head
This film documents how yoga has helped these women keep physically and mentally strong despite their ageing years. The sense of community that coming to the same teacher for over thirty years has given them has also helped them cope with life’s challenges. The film centres on Edka, who maintains that yoga has helped her overcome many tragedies in her life, including the death of her husband and daughter.
By placing a local, multicultural group of ageing women in the spotlight, it is hoped that Stand on your Head can provide a positive role model for other senior citizens.
This ‘no-budget’ film was made in Melbourne by local documentary filmmaker, Naomi Wise. The music featured in the film is an old European Jewish folk tune. Indian instruments are used to reflect the curious mix of cultures in the film. It was arranged by Melbourne music producer Adam Starr and sung in Yiddish by Karen Feldman.

results.title: Squirrel on my shoulder and Brockside
results.brief_description: Squirrel on my shoulder, narrated by Sir David Attenborough, tells the story of Sammy, an orphaned baby Grey Squirrel which was raised by a cat as one of her kittens, and eventually released back into the wild. “Brockside”, presented by Simon King, looks at the tenuous life of the urban Badger, living off its human neighbours as urban devlopment enchroaches on the lands they have traditionally occupied.

results.title: Standing Alone
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Pete Standing Alone is a Blood Indian who, as a young man, was more at home in the White man’s culture than his own. However, confronted with the realisation that his children knew very little about their origins, he became determined to pass down to them the customs and traditions of his ancestors. This hour-long film is the powerful biographical study of a twenty-five-year span in Pete’s life, from his early days as an oil-rig roughneck, rodeo rider and cowboy, to the present as an Indian concerned with preserving his tribe’s spiritual heritage in the face of an energy-oriented industrial age. Includes footage of a traditional headdress and saddle being presented to Prince Charles. Photographed by Douglas Kiefer and Ernest McNabb. Edited by Tom Daly. Music by Eldon Rathburn. Sound by Bev Davidson, Claude Hazanavicius and John Knight (Awards: San Antonio, Vancouver)

results.title: Squash Clinic
results.brief_description: Jahangir Khan - world squash champion and his coach Rahmat Khan feature in this comprehensive instructional video on squash technique. The player standard at which the video is aimed commences with beginners, includes the intermediate level and finishes with advanced instruction.

results.title: Stan King: book binder
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Stan King has been a bookbinder for forty-four years. Despite the mechanisation that has taken place, Stan believes that bookbinding is not finished as a craft and while there is a need for high quality books, there will be skilled craftsmen who will be able to produce them.

results.title: Spy Trap
results.brief_description: This Australian documentary/drama tells how the defection of Soviet spy Vladmir Petrov in Canberra 1954 led to a political crisis in Australia and the eventual ‘smoking out’ of the century’s master spy, Harold Russell (Kim) Philby - a senior KGB agent for more than fifty years. Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.

Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.

Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.

results.title: Glenn Chandler: Designer woodworker
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Glenn Chandler designs and creates articles such as terrariums and fish tanks out of wood and glass. He uses machines to cut wood into shapes as well as working by hand. The articles are sold directly the factory.

results.title: Sprout wings and fly
results.creator_credit: Les Blank, Cece Conway, Alice Gerrand and Flower Films
results.brief_description: A touching tribute to Appalachian culture in the form of a profile of the legendary mountain fiddler, Tommy Jarrell - “I eat when I’m hungry, I drink when I’m dry. If I get to feeling much better I’m going to sprout wings and fly”.
